poem:
Title: The Battle Waged In Printed Words

Noon hovers, fresh ink trails,
as Starmer stands on paper hills.
Tory tales woven in shadowed whispers,
Billionaire smear,
a cry cutting clear.
The dance of the working-class sphere,
class clashing, a "beergate" leer.
In this kaleidoscope of power,
strategy maneuvers the hour.
While truth, a shy flower,
peers through the fickle shower.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Starmer dismisses Tory attack on Rayner as ‘billionaire PM smearing working-class woman’ – UK politics live 1.57pm BST Wes Streeting, the shadow health secretary, told Radio 4’s the World at One that he thought the Conservatives were using the Angela Rayner allegations as a deliberate distraction strategy. He said: This is a familiar Conservative party playbook now. We saw this couple of years ago in relation to Durham [the “beergate” allegations] where we saw the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
